result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Slye

records.addlTxt:
1:08 PMCourt calls 22TR677, 22CF105 and 22CF168 22CF169- Defendant Matthew J. Slye in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Matthew J. Slye.  Attorney Amy Pautzke in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF169 PH-State calls Deputy Ben Schindel who is sworn and testifies.  Cross exam by Defense.  Probable cause found after preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd. Arraignment scheduled on 22CF105, 22CF168, 22DR169.  Case 22TR677 following.
Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defense argues bond.  Response by State.  Court denies bond motion.  Present bond stands.

11:24 AM Court calls 22CF105 22CF168 22CF169 and 22TR677 Defendant Matthew J. Slye in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Matthew J. Slye.  Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin.   Requests PH in 22CF169.  Waiver of Right to PH and Order to Bind Over filed in 22CF105 and 22CF168.  State believed waiver was for all three cases, therefore officer was told not to come but is now on his way.  Adj. 11:26.  Resume 11:30  Court advised witness is 32 miles away.  Court finds good cause to adjourn PH and go past time limits due to the miscommunication.  PH Rescheduled in 22CF169.
Request for In Custody Defendant to Appear In Person for Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:38 AM Court calls 22CF105, 22CF168, 22CF169 Defendant Matthew J. Slye in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Matthew J. Slye.  Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin.   Defense requests PH in 22CF168 and 22CF169 and Bond Motion on all three case will be addressed after PH.
PH/Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

to include both 22CF168 & 22CF169 w/conditions: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages.
